docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, April 23.--"Oh, don't call it moble, it was only my duty, I'm sure," said Capt. Ramilton Murrell, as he was welcomed and congratulated at the Maritime Exchange by President William Brockie this afternoon....
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, April 23.--"Oh, don't call it moble, it was only my duty, I'm sure," said Capt. Ramilton Murrell, as he was welcomed and congratulated at the Maritime Exchange by President William Brockie this afternoon.

headline.main: HONORS TO CAPT. MURRELL; MADE THE LION OF THE HOUR IN PHILADELPHIA. A RECEPTION AT WHICH THOUSANDS GRASPED HIS HAND--DECORATED WITH A GOLD MEDAL.

docs.snippet: The steamer Pilgrim of the Fall River Line and the freight boat Metropolitan, which is run between this city and New-London, came into collision on Monday night while passing through Hell Gate, both bound east....
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Pilgrim of the Fall River Line and the freight boat Metropolitan, which is run between this city and New-London, came into collision on Monday night while passing through Hell Gate, both bound east.

headline.main: COLLISION IN HELL GATE.; THE STEAMER PILGRIM ALMOST SINKS A SMALL FREIGHT BOAT.

docs.snippet: The steamship City of Savannah of the Ocean Steamship Company of Savannah, commanded by Capt. Smith, ran down the Schooner Lester A. Lewis, from Mobile, at 1 o'clock yesterday morning off Sandy Hook Lightship. Capt. Hatch of the schooner was kille...
docs.abstract: Lester A. Lewis's Collision with City of Savannah; Capt. Hatch Killed
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship City of Savannah of the Ocean Steamship Company of Savannah, commanded by Capt. Smith, ran down the Schooner Lester A. Lewis, from Mobile, at 1 o'clock yesterday morning off Sandy Hook Lightship. Capt. Hatch of the schooner was killed by the collision, and the port quarter of his vessel was completely shaved off.

headline.main: KILLED IN HIS OWN CABIN; CAPT. HATCH PERISHES IN A COLLISION. THE LESTER A. LEWIS RUN DOWN BY THE CITY OF SAVANNAH--OTHER COLLISIONS ON CROWDED WATERS. THE BETA'S EXPERIENCE. LOST WITH THE ALBERT RUSSELL.

docs.snippet: The steamship Orinoco from Bermuda, which arrived yesterday, brought in tow the steamship Wingates, before reported disabled. Capt. Thompson of the Wingates reports that he encountered a succession of heavy gales until March 13, when he was 60 mil...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Orinoco from Bermuda, which arrived yesterday, brought in tow the steamship Wingates, before reported disabled. Capt. Thompson of the Wingates reports that he encountered a succession of heavy gales until March 13, when he was 60 miles south-southeast of Montauk.

headline.main: BAD WEATHER AT SEA.; INCOMING VESSELS BRING STORIES OF GALES AND HURRICANES.

docs.snippet: The three-masted schooner Allie R. Chester, Capt. Ingersoil, while bound from Charleston, S.C., with phosphates to Barren Island, was struck by a squall on Jan. 20 and driven ashore on the Diamond Shoals, II miles off Cape Hatteras. Just before sh...
docs.lead_paragraph: The three-masted schooner Allie R. Chester, Capt. Ingersoil, while bound from Charleston, S.C., with phosphates to Barren Island, was struck by a squall on Jan. 20 and driven ashore on the Diamond Shoals, II miles off Cape Hatteras. Just before she struck, First Mate Willis was washed overboard and lost.

headline.main: WRECKED OFF HATTERAS.; THE CAPTAIN LOST WITHIN AN HOUR OF HIS WIFE'S DEATH ASHORE.

docs.snippet: NEW-ORLEANS, Jan. 19.--With the sinking of the Natchez probably the last large Mississippi River steamboat has disappeared. She was the seventh of the name, and excepting the Robert E. Lee was perhaps the most renowned and popular boat that ever c...
docs.abstract: Natchez; Seven Mississippi River Steamboats so Named
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW-ORLEANS, Jan. 19.--With the sinking of the Natchez probably the last large Mississippi River steamboat has disappeared. She was the seventh of the name, and excepting the Robert E. Lee was perhaps the most renowned and popular boat that ever carried passengers or freight on the river.

headline.main: THE LAST NATCHEZ GONE; CAPT. LEATHERS TOO OLD TO BUILD ANOTHER. SEVEN MISSISSIPPI RIVER STEAMBOATS NAMED AFTER "NATCHEZ UNDER THE HILL"--THE OLD CAPTAIN.

docs.snippet: PANAMA, May 22, via Galveston.--The Pacific Mail steamship City of Para, which left Colon on the 16th inst. for New-York, went ashore on Old Providence Island on the 17th ......
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA, May 22, via Galveston.--The Pacific Mail steamship City of Para, which left Colon on the 16th inst. for New-York, went ashore on Old Providence Island on the 17th ...

headline.main: THE CITY OF PARA ASHORE.; SHE IS STILL AGROUND, BUT HER PASSENGERS ARE SAFE.

docs.snippet: The NOrwegian bark Vegar, Capt. Olsen, which arrived at Quarantine yesterday, had on board the crew of the Norwegian bark Venerate, which was abandoned on Nov. 17, in latitude 37 and longitude 14 30. Capt. Olsen reports sailing from Oporto on Nov....
docs.lead_paragraph: The NOrwegian bark Vegar, Capt. Olsen, which arrived at Quarantine yesterday, had on board the crew of the Norwegian bark Venerate, which was abandoned on Nov. 17, in latitude 37 and longitude 14 30. Capt. Olsen reports sailing from Oporto on Nov. 11. On the seventh day out a sailing vessel, evidently in distress, was observed, and the Vegar approached her.

headline.main: A SHIP WRECKED CREW; RESCUED FROM THE NORWEGIAN BARK VENERATA.

docs.snippet: The steam-ship Zanzibar, of West Hartlepool, England, sailed from this port for Glasgow on Jan. 11, and has not been heard from since....
docs.lead_paragraph: The steam-ship Zanzibar, of West Hartlepool, England, sailed from this port for Glasgow on Jan. 11, and has not been heard from since.

headline.main: RUMORED LOSS OF A STEAM-SHIP.; THE ZANZIBAR GIVEN UP AT THE BRITISH LLOYDS--HER OFFICERS AND CARGO.
